intro: Callitriche verna f. stellata, commonly known as star-leaved water starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Haloragaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, ditches, and slow-moving streams. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. This species is often found in nutrient-rich waters and is adapted to tolerate fluctuating water levels.
